SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
REPORT AND REDUCE YOUR CARBON FOOTPRINT WITH NET ZERO CLOUD
Create a Stationary Asset Energy Use Record

Create a record for each reporting or billing period per stationary asset.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience
Available in: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions


USER PERMISSIONS
NEEDED
To enter and modify stationary asset energy use data:	

Net Zero Cloud Manager

OR

Net Zero Cloud Admin

OR

Net Zero Cloud Light

The fields that are used for emissions calculations depend on whether the asset is a commercial building or a data center.

Commercial building: To track emissions by region and carry over data from the asset, such as building floor area and emissions factors, associate the record with a building stationary asset. These fields are used for calculations:
Allocated Renewable Energy (kWh)
Appropriate fields in the Energy Consumption Values section
Electricity Emissions Factors (lookup)
Market-Based Electricity Emissions Factors (lookup)
Occupied Floor Area (only if the Refrigerant Emissions Factor field is populated)
Occupied Floor Area Unit
Other Emissions Factors (lookup)
Refrigerant Emissions Factor (lookup)
Renewable Energy Type
Stationary Asset Environmental Source (lookup)

When you create a record, or when you remove the total floor area or occupied floor area values from an existing record, those fields are initialized from the stationary asset environmental source record.

Data center: To track emissions by region, associate a data center with a building organization asset. These fields are used for calculations:
Appropriate fields in the Energy Consumption Values section
Allocated Renewable Energy (kWh)
Electricity Emissions Factors (lookup)
Market-Based Electricity Emissions Factors (lookup)
Other Emissions Factors (lookup)
Power Usage Effectiveness
Refrigerant Emissions Factor (lookup)
Renewable Energy Type
Stationary Asset Environmental Source (lookup)

These energy use fields are calculated based on the input values and the emissions factors.

Allocated Energy Attribute Credits (kWh)
Allocated Energy Attribute Credits from Biomass (kWh)
Allocated Energy Attribute Credits from Geothermal (kWh)
Allocated Energy Attribute Credits from Wind (kWh)
Allocated Energy Attribute Credits from Solar (kWh)
Fuel Consumption (GJ)
Fuel Consumption (kWh)
Location-Based Electricity from Biomass (kWh)
Location-Based Electricity from Coal (kWh)
Location-Based Electricity from Gas (kWh)
Location-Based Electricity from Hydro (kWh)
Location-Based Electricity from Nuclear (kWh)
Location-Based Electricity from Oil (kWh)
Location-Based Electricity from Other Fuel (kWh)
Location-Based Electricity from Solar (kWh)
Location-Based Electricity from Wind (kWh)
Location-Based Electricity from Non-Renewables (kWh)
Location-Based Electricity from Geothermal (kWh)
Location-Based Electricity from Other Fossil Fuel (kWh)
Market-Based CH4 Emissions (kg)
Market-Based CO2 Emissions (kg)
Market-Based N2O Emissions (kg)
Market-Based Electricity from Biomass (kWh)
Market-Based Electricity from Coal (kWh)
Market-Based Electricity from Gas (kWh)
Market-Based Electricity from Hydro (kWh)
Market-Based Electricity from Nuclear (kWh)
Market-Based Electricity from Oil (kWh)
Market-Based Electricity from Other Fuel (kWh)
Market-Based Electricity from Solar (kWh)
Market-Based Electricity from Wind (kWh)
Market-Based Electricity from Non-Renewables (kWh)
Market-Based Electricity from Geothermal (kWh)
Market-Based Electricity from Other Fossil Fuel (kWh)
Normalized Monthly Electricity Consumption (kWh)
Occupied Floor Area (sqft)
Power Usage Effectiveness Monthly Range
Scope 1 Emissions (tCO2e)
Scope 2 Location-Based Emissions (tCO2e)
Scope 2 Market-Based Emissions (tCO2e)
Scope 3 Downstream Emissions (tCO2e)
Scope 3 Upstream Emissions. (tCO2e)
Total Floor Area (sqft)
Total Renewable Energy (kWh)
Total Renewable Energy Excluding Hydro (kWh)
Total Fuel Consumption (kWh)

From the App Launcher, find and select Stationary Asset Energy Use.
Click New.
Enter a record name.
Select a value for Stationary Asset Environmental Source.

The emissions factors related to the asset are added to this energy use record when you save it. If you select a value for an emissions factor, your selection overrides the emissions factor that is related to the asset.

The Company-Owned Asset value is derived from stationary asset environmental source. This value affects calculations for scope 1 and scope 2 emissions.

Select a fuel type and a matching fuel consumption unit.
Select an Other Emissions Factor Set Item record as the value for Other Emissions Factors.

When you select the diesel fuel type, which can be a stationary or a mobile fuel type, ensure that the Other Emissions Factor Set Item record selected is associated with the appropriate emissions factor units for diesel. For more information, see Other Emissions Factor Set Item Supplied Emission Factors in Conversion Factors.

If needed, enter information for the optional fields.
Save your changes.
Fuel Consumption Units by Fuel Type
The Stationary Asset Energy Use object represents the energy consumption related to stationary assets across multiple fuel types.
